document_data.caption: A stone wolf lays stationary on a moonlit night.
document_data.name: Stone Wolf
document_data.mainbody: '''Stone wolves''' were a type of stone [[construct]].{{Cite dragon/174/Cry Wolf!|27}}
document_data.Description: These constructs varied in appearance along a general [[wolf]] theme, though they always had white-hot [[fire opal]]s for eyes.
document_data.Behavior: These constructs had a degree of intellect comparable to that of an animal.

Abilities.Senses: If necessary, a stone wolf was capable of tracking creatures through hearing and sight. They could not track by smell.

document_data.Combat: These constructs fought in a similar manner to their namesake. They typically stood still until an enemy approached them.

Society.Construction: Stone wolves were constructed by [[mage]]s, typically in batches of four. They began with lumps of purified clay with two fire opals and the skull of a wolf embedded in them. The mage would cast a specially modified version of the spell ''[[stone shape]]'' on the clay, followed by a specially modified version of ''[[animate dead]]'' the next day. During the period between those two castings, the mage could not cast any other spells.
Society.Relationships: Stones wolves acted as [[favored monster|servants]] of the [[duergar]] [[deities]] [[Deep Duerra]] and [[Laduguer]], as well as the [[halfling]] deity of [[earth (element)|earth]] [[Urogalan]].
